channel.title: 金融时报
channel.description: 这是一个追踪金融时报news的种子

item.title: 美国人对信用卡债务感到紧张：在本月早些时候为《金融时报》和密歇根罗斯公司进行的一项民意调查中，28% 的人认为信用卡债务是他们财务压力的最大来源之一
item.description:
Americans are stressed about credit card debt: 28% cited it as one of their biggest sources of financial stress in a poll for the Financial Times and Michigan Ross conducted earlier this month https://t.co/8teOBCUR6K pic.twitter.com/Sujyd0sulK

— Financial Times (@FT) March 20, 2024

item.title: 波音公司在经历了最近的危机后，不得不限制其 737 Max 飞机的生产，以提高制造质量。该公司还在应对监管部门日益严格的审查
item.description:
Boeing has had to limit production of its 737 Max aircraft after its latest crisis as it seeks to improve the quality of its manufacturing. The company is also dealing with increased regulatory scrutiny https://t.co/rzixZEYx1Z pic.twitter.com/DKvyRTZysE

— Financial Times (@FT) March 20, 2024

item.title: 因担心俄罗斯交易，德国莱弗森银行撤回 AT1 债券交易
item.description:

item.title: 摩根大通（JPMorgan）上周发表了一份有趣的说明，巧妙地将市场低波动率的部分责任归咎于由......经营的期权基金。..摩根资产管理公司。这是怎么回事呢？
item.description:
JPMorgan last week published an interesting note that subtly apportions some of the blame for low levels of market volatility on an options fund run by . . . JPMorgan Asset Management. What’s going on? https://t.co/2EbIzZ2dBe pic.twitter.com/1RrSnkXH9Z

— Financial Times (@FT) March 20, 2024

item.title: 英国通胀率的下降幅度超过预期，这增强了英国央行开始降息的论据，也让英国首相苏纳克（Rishi Sunak）抓住这一消息，证明他的经济计划正在发挥作用。以下为 @ft 提供的《中断的时代
item.description:
A bigger than expected fall in UK inflation has bolstered arguments for the Bank of England to start cutting interest rates and allowed PM Rishi Sunak to seize on the news as proof his economic plan was working. Here's Disrupted Timeshttps://t.co/wd5cWQGaxk via @ft

— darrendodd (@darrendodd) March 20, 2024

item.title: 道德金钱 "新闻：花旗集团同意披露其对低碳能源和化石燃料的相对财政支持水平，即所谓的绿色融资比率，纽约市主计长因此获胜。
item.description:

item.title: "特朗普的财务窘境会给国家安全带来风险，这一点不需要高超的洞察力也能看出来。如果友好的亿万富翁们认为他的信用风险太大，那么谁会代替他来保释他呢？特朗普能提供什么样的抵押品作为回报呢？我的专栏
item.description:
"It doesn't take great insight to see that Trump’s financial quandary poses a national security risk. If friendly billionaires think he's too big a credit risk, who might bail him out instead? What sort of collateral could Trump offer in return?" My column https://t.co/bGqnQne8hy

— Edward Luce (@EdwardGLuce) March 20, 2024
